content: How did you create this backup? Thunderbird doesn't create backups on its own. If you created a new profile, the old one should be in the Profiles folder at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles

content:
my Gmail account has stopped downloading to Thunderbird.

What error message do you get?

Also, please post your Troubleshooting Information. At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button ‚â°, then select Help > More Troubleshooting Information. Press the "Copy text to clipboard button" and paste the information into your reply.

Have looked for solutions online, the one I saw here suggested changing the saved password in Thunderbird

You cannot change your account password via Thunderbird. All you did was changing the password Thunderbird has remembered for your account. And this is only if you don't use OAuth2 authentication for your Gmail account, which may be your problem in the first place.
creator: christ1

content: Check the online account to confirm that the messages are being deleted. If so, then the PC is likely a POP setup that is downloading and leaving on server. A check of the setup will clarify this.

content: nstmp files are the detritus remains of an attempted compaction that failed. Just delete. I was anticipating this. If you have very large message folders, this may happen periodically,

I've just checked again, and that same file (in the Employment folder) is clicking ever upwards in size - it's got to 240Gb as I write.

content: I don't know the inner technical aspects of Thunderbird, so it's possible there is a bug somewhere, but my guess is you may have an antivirus product that is interfering with compacting. My suggestion is to adjust the Disk Space parameters in Settings>general, and possibly tick to be informed when TB is about to compact.
creator: davidsk

content:
Una PEC √® una mail con due allegati che per convenzione si chiamano proprio POSTACERT.EML E DATICERT.XML. Gli allegati inclusi in POSTACERT.EML sono visbili solo se apri questo allegato.

Se prima Thunderbird si comportava diversamente, forse avevi installo qualche estensione o fatto delle modifiche alla configurazione.

In generale la PEC non √® nativamente supportata da Thunderbird essendo una esclusiva della burocrazia italiana. Se il tuo fornitore fornisce una guida di riferimento √® a quella che devi guardare per configurare la PEC. Non esiste una soluzione unica perch√© ogni fornitore ha le proprie impostazioni.

content: Gli utenti che partecipano a support.mozilla.org conoscono solo le informazioni scritte nei vari messaggi. Quando apri una nuova discussione dovresti quindi fornire il maggior numero possibile di informazioni utili ad identificare il tuo problema. Scrivere ad esempio Thunderbird non funziona pi√π non √® di nessuna utilit√† e le uniche risposte che eventualmente riceverai saranno richieste di chiarimento. In generale dovresti fornire almeno queste informazioni: - Versione di Firefox o Thunderbird - Elenco delle eventuali estensioni installate - Descrizione del problema riscontrato e di come si manifesta - Tipo di configurazione (ad esempio se IMAP o POP3 nel caso di Thunderbird)
creator: @next

content:
My ISP insists the problem is not with their server
An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Spam detected by content scanner. Message rejected (ID 665754780026FB52).

The error message is from your ISPs mail server. So they are the one causing the problem for you.

I need to have Mozilla correct it.

There is nothing Mozilla can do about it. What you could try though is

  • send email in plain text instead of HTML
  • don't use any linked files in your email signature
  • avoid attachments

None of that will actually solve the underlying problem. It's just an attempt to work around an overly sensible spam detection mechanism your ISP has implemented which generates false positives for you.

Another workaround may be to use webmail to send those problematic messages.
creator: christ1

content: Enter creates a new paragraph not a new line. And check 'View', 'Sort by', 'Unthreaded'
